citation.article-title: Stenotrophomonas ginsengisoli sp. nov., isolated from a ginseng field
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Stenotrophomonas ginsengisoli sp. nov.
Stenotrophomonas ginsengisoli (gin.seng.i.so′li. N.L. n. ginsengum ginseng; L. n. solum soil; N.L. gen. n. ginsengisoli of soil of a ginseng field, the source of the type strain).
Cells are Gram-reaction-negative, non-motile, aerobic rods that are 1.0–1.5×0.5–0.8 μm in size after growth on R2A agar plates (Difco) at 25 °C for 3 days.
Colonies on R2A agar plates after 2 days are yellow, glossy and circular.
Optimal growth occurs at 30 °C and pH 7.0, and in the presence of 2 % NaCl.
Produces biopolymer-hydrolysing enzymes such as cellulase, DNase and protease, but not amylase, chitinase, lipase or xylanase.
The major polar lipids are phosphatidylethanolamine, phosphatidylglycerol and diphosphatidylglycerol.
The major cellular fatty acids are iso-C15 : 0, C16 : 0 10-methyl, iso-C15 : 1 F and C15 : 0.

Assimilates N-acetylglucosamine, d-glucose, 3-hydroxybutyrate, maltose, d-mannitol, l-proline, l-rhamnose and valerate, but not acetate, adipate, l-arabinose, l-alanine, caprate, citrate, l-fucose, gluconate, glycogen, l-histidine, 3-hydroxybenzoate, 4-hydroxybenzoate, itaconate, 2-ketogluconate, 5-ketogluconate, malate, malonate, d-mannose, melibiose, myo-inositol, lactate, phenylacetate, propionate, d-ribose, salicin, l-serine, d-sorbitol, suberate or sucrose.
Other phenotypic characteristics, such as substrate utilization and enzyme production, are summarized in Table 1.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 65.4–65.8 % (HPLC).
The type strain, DCY01T (=KCTC 12539T=NBRC 101154T), was isolated from soil of a ginseng field in Daejeon city, South Korea.
